1.brief: properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
sterile (as if extirpated in the generative organs)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)
to gleam, i.e. (figuratively) be cheerful; by transference to sound clear (of various animal or human expressions)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to be master; hence, to marry

2.brief: to broaden (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe
to be (causative, make) long (literally or figuratively)
a cord (of a tent); or the string (of a bow)
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
properly, dark (as enveloped), i.e. the north; hence (by orientation), the left hand
to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative)
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach

to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

to be master; hence, to marry
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
properly, to carve, i.e. fabricate or fashion; hence (in a bad sense) to worry, pain or anger
